title: Robert518
author: Robert518
content: The expected Ethereum move to proof-of-stake may be nearing completion, as developers just published probable dates for the mainnet merging.The developers have been delaying the transition of Ethereum from the proof of work to the proof of stake consensus model for years, but the complete transition to Ethereum 2.0 is now close to becoming a reality after the final trial run was successfully executed on the Goerli network earlier this week.The likely date was revealed after core developers such as Tim Beiko and Prysmatic Labs co-founder Terence Tsao agreed in an Aug. 11 developer call that the change will be place when the Total Terminal Difficulty (TTD) reaches 58750000000000000000000.Continue Reading: https://mycryptoparadise.com/ethereum-merge-to-be-launched-in-september-developers/

comments.author: paid2
comments.body: Quote from: Robert518 on August 13, 2022, 07:33:33 AMThe expected Ethereum move to proof-of-stake may be nearing completion, as developers just published probable dates for the mainnet merging.The developers have been delaying the transition of Ethereum from the proof of work to the proof of stake consensus model for years, but the complete transition to Ethereum 2.0 is now close to becoming a reality after the final trial run was successfully executed on the Goerli network earlier this week.The likely date was revealed after core developers such as Tim Beiko and Prysmatic Labs co-founder Terence Tsao agreed in an Aug. 11 developer call that the change will be place when the Total Terminal Difficulty (TTD) reaches 58750000000000000000000.Continue Reading: https://mycryptoparadise.com/ethereum-merge-to-be-launched-in-september-developers/Yes it is almost strange to see that it's not delayed one more timeÂ  Vitalik said that gas fees shoud be low as 0.02usd after some time after the merge.Maybe it is off topic but I wonder how it will influence ETC difficulty and price ? Do you have a opinion about that ?
